text: 4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Dark brownish with beige to light tan head. Aromas of caramel, light spice, dark fruit. Tastes of milk chocolate, cocoa, light spice, caramel, dark fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

Wonderfully subtle and awesone mix. Bretta works in here smooth like pick up lines after 8 drinks. Pours hazy brown with good head and lacing. Light caramel. A tiny bit of date. Light sweet finish with note of crackery Bretta. Tap at Churchkey.

Keg at the Kings Arms, 14/11/16.
Mahogany brown with a decent tan cap.
Nose is chocolate, light roasted underpin, spice, mellow fruit rinds.
Taste comprises cocoa powder, light peppery spice, toffee, biscuit, soft malts, fruit loaf.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at hanging bat... Still to pay.... Murky brown black... Small tan head.. Dark chocolate fruits nose... Dark black.. Bitter chocolate roast.. Dark malts soft roast.. Long dry chocolate.. Little thin
(En fût à Tap & Bottle): Un gros nez de lactose et de grains rôtis un peu maladroit. Cest un peu trop sucré mais étonnamment mince.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours deep brown, nose is cinnamon, chocolate, caramel, fruity, taste is sweet, roasted, chewy caramel, fruity.

Keg at The Kings Arms, Bethnal Green, London. Dark brown with beige head. There is a rich maltiness to this, darkly roasted notes with a bitter edge, some dryness, some earthy fruitiness, there is a prune like character. I didnt really get the brett addition but all in all a very decent beer.

Keg at the Kings Arms - London. Pours deep brown, clear, with a creamy off-white head. The nose holds moderate roast, light tangy berries, leather. Medium sweet flavour with sugary brown bread, mellow chocolate, ripe berries, low bitterness. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet in the finish, with more toasted bread, mellow cocoa, leathery berries. Not much brett. Enjoyable.

Lightly sweet dark fruits, spices, dark, toasted malts, very light coffee. Hazy brown, small, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More dried, dark fruits, dates, more spices, cinnamon, maybe some cloves, light coffee and very dark chocolate, cacao, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice Brown Ale, great touch with the dates and the cinnamon. Keg at The Kings Arms, Bethnal Green.
Brownish red. Sweet porter. stonefruit.  Rounds out with a tart cherry taste on palate, but very delicate tartness.  Interesting beer.....well done.  Another treat from ibrew2or3 (a growler!)

Nitro pour from the source. Dark chestnut body with a one inch thick whipped meringue khaki head. Aromas of dark fruit, prunes, plums. Roast and chocolate with a mild fruity sweetness. Distant notes of dried leather. A hint of cinnamon and a touch of brown sugar. Nicely done.
Draft at brewery, on nitro, sweet and rich, good roasty flavors with some lactose type flavors in there. Takes like a milk stout on nitro, faint spices. Its pretty nice

On tap @ Arizona Wilderness. Very dark brown pour with a khaki head. Cinnamon sugar dominates the nose. A bunch dark fruit, I assume the dates? Fig newton cookies, some roast, and dark chocolate. Flavor is pretty much like cinnamon and fig newtons. Dates, raisins, and a bunch of roasted malt. Some coffee and a touch of ash. A weird aftertaste I cant quite pin down.

On tap at the brewery. Dark brown appearance with a tan head. Aroma and flavor of light spices, roasted/nutty malts, lightly earthy, chocolate, cinnamon and dark fruits. Mildly sweet, lightly bitter and a little funky. Pretty tasty!
Nice malty smell and taste. Medium body and low but sharp carbonation. Aftertaste is bittersweet malt.
Very nice. Thinner porter with a great nutty aroma and flavors. Good but lives in the shadow of some of Wildernesss other great porter offerings.

Poured up on tap into a squat tulip glass at the Wilderness. It pours with a dark amber body that supports a tan head. The aroma offers up chocolate, molasses covered cherries, black licorice and some earth dark roasted malts. The taste has a mix of dark roasted malts, chocolate, a light earthy tobacco note and then dark sweet cherry like fruity notes wrapped in dried molasses. A bit on the fruity side but pretty nice.

Draft at brewpub. Pours dark dark brown mapely reddish. Small beige head, minimally lasting. Coffee, chocolate, little toffee, some natural sweetness from the dates, a little funk. Balanced sweet and toasty. Medium to light body. Moderately creamy, tiny bit of sourness. Complex and interesting.

On tap at the brewery. A - pours a dark brown with lighter cola edges. A light tan head sits on top and quickly subsides. No lacing. S - dirt, chocolate and dates are prominent. Blackberries, raspberries, tart apples and rhubarb as well. Waffle batter. Some graham cracker and dry biscuit. M - medium oily body with a medium palate and good carbonation. T - dates, chocolate and dirt early. Some mineral water characteristics throughout. Middle is berries, hops and citrus. Mild cinnamon. Ending is light and clean with mostly lingering berry and mineral water.

On tap at the brewery. Funky, thick aroma of bitterroot, carob, some dark berry tones, a hint of leather, and chocolate malt. Pours a flat super-dark brown with a foamy tan head. Incredibly clean flavor with light cocoa, roasted malt, toasted nuts, and just a hint of the Brett funkiness (though it pops more as the beer warms). Well done, beards!
Very dark brown pour, wispy tan head. Aroma is light, some funk, berries, tart cherries, leather. Lightly tart on the tongue, some earthy flavors, hay, leather, chocolate finish. Nice.

Dark brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruits and faint earthiness. Taste of roasted malts, faint dates, hint of caramel sweetness, touch of chocolate, hint of lactose. Medium bodied, perfect carbonation. Nothing over the top, just a perfectly balanced kick ass, drink all day beer. First time at their brewpub and instantly can tell these guys brew some quality beers. Excellent beer!

At the brewery, dark brown pour with a tan head. Roasty and some dark fruit aroma. Taste has dates, chocolate and just a touch of funky goodness. Unique beer and tasty. Let it warm to let the flavor really come out.
